keyTakeAways: Eating 2 to 3 kiwifruits per day can help relieve chronic constipation based on new dietary guidelines.
The guidelines recommend specific foods like kiwifruit, rye bread, and high-mineral water, rather than a general fiber increase.
Chronic constipation affects 1 in 6 to 7 people globally and 9% to 20% of adults in the U.S., with symptoms including fewer than three bowel movements per week, hard stool, and straining.
Kiwifruit improves stool bulk, enhances digestion, accelerates transit time, and has natural prebiotic effects; the skin contains extra fiber.
Avoid heating kiwis, as heat destroys the enzyme that aids gut movement.
Alternatives include prunes, rye bread, flaxseeds, oranges, yogurt, beans, oatmeal, and supplements like psyllium (10g/day, starting low).
Physical activity, such as walking, is also recommended as a lifestyle change.
The recommendations are based on 75 randomized controlled trials and four systematic reviews and meta-analyses.
The guidelines apply to healthy adults with chronic idiopathic constipation and are not recommended for those with constipation due to neurological conditions, pregnancy, or children.

summaryOfNewsArticle: New dietary guidelines, co-published by the Journal of Human Nutrition and Dietetics and Neurogastroenterology & Motility on October 13, 2025, recommend specific, evidence-based foods such as 2 to 3 kiwifruits per day, rye bread, and high-mineral-content water to help relieve chronic constipation. The guidelines, which are based on 75 randomized controlled trials and four systematic reviews, target healthy adults with chronic idiopathic constipation—commonly affecting 1 in 6 to 7 people globally and 9% to 20% of U.S. adults. The study emphasizes targeted dietary interventions over general fiber advice, with kiwifruit being highlighted for its ease of use, low tolerance for adverse effects, and ability to improve stool movement, digestion, and gut health. Alternatives include prunes, flaxseeds, yogurt, and oatmeal. Supplements like psyllium (10g/day) and physical activity such as walking are also recommended. The guidelines do not apply to individuals with constipation due to neurological conditions, pregnancy, or children, and caution is advised due to the lack of focus on underlying medical causes.
title: Eating 2 to 3 Kiwis a Day Can Relieve Chronic Constipation, According to New Dietary Guidelines
